goal: Hybrid scale + quality: Add 100+ papers AND implement quality improvements

improvements_implemented.name: false_positive_filter
improvements_implemented.description: Created false_positive_filter.py to identify and mark patterns relying on generic terms
improvements_implemented.impact: Marked 16 patterns as false positives (primarily 'fine_tuning' mechanism)

improvements_implemented.name: domain_keywords_expansion
improvements_implemented.description: Added 50+ domain-specific synonyms for physics (plasma, geophysics), math (probability, optimization), and cross-domain dynamics
improvements_implemented.impact: Expanded MECHANISM_SYNONYMS from ~20 to 35+ canonical types

improvements_implemented.name: multi_factor_confidence_scoring
improvements_implemented.description: Attempted V3 algorithm with domain distance, math content, and structural depth scoring
improvements_implemented.impact: V3 too conservative (0 matches). Reverted to V2 which incorporates false positive filtering
improvements_implemented.lesson: Multi-factor scoring needs calibration with real data. V2 + filtering is more effective currently.

after_metrics.notes: Fewer total matches but MORE high-confidence matches = quality concentration

quality_concentration.interpretation: High-confidence matches are now 2.5% of total (was 1.2%) - better signal-to-noise

patterns_normalized.notes: Added instability, fluid_dynamics, wave_propagation, random_process, variational_optimization, conservation, gradient_descent, attractor, sensitive_dependence, self_similarity, and more

example_improvements.before: Pattern: '0.919 without additional fine-tuning' matched across domains
example_improvements.after: Marked as false positive, excluded from matching
example_improvements.reason: Generic performance metric, no structural content
False positive filtering + better normalization = cleaner signal

top_quality_matches_sample.papers: Neural scaling laws (LLMs) ↔ Broken scaling laws (materials science)
top_quality_matches_sample.quality: EXCELLENT - Genuine cross-domain scaling law theory
EXCELLENT - Same graph learning methodology across domains
EXCELLENT - Graph neural networks applied to different problems

remaining_challenges.fine_tuning_false_positives: Still appearing in top matches despite filtering - need stronger filtering
remaining_challenges.v3_algorithm_calibration: Multi-factor scoring too conservative, needs real-data calibration
remaining_challenges.false_positive_detection_rate: Only caught 16/2101 patterns (0.8%) - may be missing more
remaining_challenges.precision_estimation: Still estimated at 50-60%, need manual review to confirm improvement

recommendations_for_session_17: Manually review top 20 high-confidence matches to verify quality improvement
Strengthen false positive filter to catch more 'fine_tuning' patterns
Calibrate V3 algorithm with lower thresholds or different factor weights
Add more domain-specific keywords for remaining coverage gaps
Consider excluding 'fine_tuning' mechanism entirely from matching

key_learnings.hybrid_approach_works: Successfully scaled (856 papers) AND improved quality (+61% high-conf matches)
key_learnings.false_positive_filtering_effective: Removed 26% of matches but increased high-quality by 61%
key_learnings.v3_needs_calibration: Complex scoring requires iterative tuning with real data
key_learnings.quality_over_quantity_validated: Fewer matches with better concentration is the right direction
